news.title: Woman (40s) quizzed over Steven O’Meara’s murder suspected of ordering brutal killing
news.summary: A woman being questioned over the savage killing of Steven O’Meara, who was buried alive 16 years ago, is suspected of ordering the murder.

news.title: UCC student claims father was ‘thrown down flight of stairs’ during illegal eviction
news.summary: A court has ordered a landlord to pay €7,100 to a tenant who was illegally evicted while undergoing his first-year college exams.

news.title: Number of households behind in their energy bills jumps 86,000 in just a year, as average of what debtors owe revealed
news.summary: The number of households behind on their energy bills has soared by 86,000 in the year to April, figures obtained by the  Irish Independent  confirm.

news.title: Rory McIlroy ahead of home Open: ‘I want to win it and I feel I’m capable’
news.summary: Past performance is no guarantee of future results and Rory McIlroy and Shane Lowry are prepared to turn the clock back to zero as they chase Open glory for the home team at Royal Portrush.

news.title: Gabija Gataveckaite: Fine Gael morphing into Sinn Féin with ‘coronations’ instead of elections
news.summary: Micheál Martin called it in 2016. At his party’s ard fheis, he attacked Fine Gael’s time in government and declared that the party wanted “a coronation. not an election”.

news.title: The Indo Daily: Mary Lou McDonald, Ireland’s next president?
news.summary: Every man and his dog seems to have been linked to the Áras at some point. Former Taoisigh, human rights advocates and cage fighters alike have thrown their names into the mix. Sinn Fein president has seemingly U-turned on a previous decision to rule herself out.

news.title: ‘Unstainable’ absenteeism has become a significant risk to An Post’s future, annual report claims
news.summary: “Unsustainable levels of absenteeism” are cited in An Post’s annual report as one of the principal risks and uncertainties facing the semi-state company.

news.title: ‘Any defect and it will break a lot easier’ – craftsmen reveal what makes the perfect hurley ahead of Cork v Tipperary All-Ireland showdown
news.summary: Two giants of hurling face off at Croke Park in the All-Ireland final on Sunday – and the difference between Cork and Tipperary at the final whistle could come down to the pieces of wood in their hands.

news.title: Restaurant Patrick Guilbaud review: ‘It’s more fun — and less arrogant — than it used to be, and I consider our €404 lunch bill to be good value right now’
news.summary: Restaurant Patrick Guilbaud is one of Paris' best known restaurants. The restaurant is located on James Place East in the heart of the city.

news.title: The Irish Independent’s View: Ignoring global storm clouds could come at a crippling cost for the Coalition
news.summary: The tradition of shooting the messenger has long been done away with. No bad thing, perhaps, as with the bad news coming thick and fast from all directions, there might be very few left standing.
